chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Todd A Tantillo in court.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Todd A Tantillo.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties request plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Todd A Tantillo in court.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Todd A Tantillo.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties request second PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:31 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Devonte D Windham.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lester M or Isaac A except only in the professional capacity. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

03:04 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
